diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient's clinical presentation included sharp/dull periumbilical pain localized to the right lower quadrant (RLQ), fever, nausea, anorexia, and diarrhea, which along with imaging (CT abdomen and pelvis) revealed a markedly dilated appendix measuring up to 1.5 cm with wall hyperemia and extensive surrounding inflammatory changes, consistent with acute perforated appendicitis.
